newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: CORDIANT TAKES 51 PCT OF S.AFRICAN SAATCHI.
newsitem.headline: CORDIANT TAKES 51 PCT OF S.AFRICAN SAATCHI.

text.p: South African advertising group Saatchi & Saatchi Klerck & Barrett (SSKB) said Cordiant Plc's Saatchi & Saatchi Advertising Worldwide had taken a 51 percent stake in the concern for an undisclosed amount.
SSKB chairman Jurie Snyman said on Tuesday the acquisition by the British group was a vote of confidence in the company, which ranks as South Africa's seventh largest agency in terms of billings.

"It shows confidence in the South Africa market and in this company's performance," he told Reuters, adding the agency had registered annual growth in business ranging between 23 and 30 percent in the past three years.
A further attraction was the network of agencies built by SSKB in 16 sub-Saharan countries, he said.
"With the multinationals returning to South Africa it is very nice for the guys in the Worldwide network to be able to offer one-stop shopping in Africa."

The deal with Cordiant will leave a black consortium as the largest majority South African shareholder in SSKB with a 26 percent share. Snyman said Cordiant had been keen to ensure a continued significant black ownership of the company.
South Africa's total advertising spend last year was around 4.55 billion rand.
